section.heading: Program participation and procedures.

para.text: If, at any time, a participant is subject to an order or is involved in an action of a tribunal, OVSJG shall notify the relevant tribunal of the participant's certification.
No person shall be compelled to disclose a participant's actual address during any proceeding before a tribunal unless the tribunal finds, based upon clear and convincing evidence, that:
A party will suffer material harm without disclosure of the participant's actual address;
The harm to the participant is substantially outweighed by the material harm to the party requesting disclosure of the participant's actual address;
There are no alternatives to disclosure of the participant's actual address that would address the material harm; and
The disclosure is narrowly tailored in both scope and manner to disclose the minimum amount of participant information necessary to address the material harm.
A tribunal may seal the portion of any record that contains a participant's actual address.

Nothing in this subchapter, including the fact that a person is a participant, shall affect an existing or future order relating to the allocation of custody, parental responsibilities, or parenting time.
Participation in the Program shall not constitute evidence of a covered offense.

Whenever the laws of the District provide a participant a legal duty to act within a prescribed period of 10 days or less after the service of a notice or other paper upon the participant, and the notice or paper is served upon the participant by mail pursuant to this subchapter, 5 days shall be added to the prescribed period.
